item.description:
We've reserved the Screening room at 360 State Street for another Movie Night! Come see a film for free at this great location!

RSVP's are limited to 18 due to theater size, so please only say "Yes" if you're pretty sure you can make it. (There should be NO Maybe's for this event.)

Attendees: I will also need your FULL NAME (and that of any +1) for the Concierge to let you in.  Please Provide when you RSVP.  (Email, Event Comment, or Text me.)

This Events Film Is:

28 Days Later(2002 - 113 min. - Horror/Sci-Fi)

IMBD Description: Four weeks after a mysterious, incurable virus spreads throughout the UK, a handful of survivors try to find sanctuary.

Staring: Cillian Murphy, Naomie Harris, Brendan Gleeson, Christopher Eccleston

AJ's Comments:  October is comming, and so is the season for scary movies of all sorts.  This is probably my favorite Zombie movie of all time, as I find it a bit deeper than many other undead flicks.  It deals with themes related to family's, emotions, instincts, and human nature.  If there's enough time and interest at the end I will show the Alternate Endings.

Event start time is 7:00 for the social portion, so you can start showing up then. But we will not start the film until 7:45 or shortly there after, but don't plan to be any later.

Feel free to use the waiting list. If someone else backs out you can be automatically added, just provide your full name for the concierge as a contingency.

Snacks: Bring your own Snacks and Beverages. (Just Please be careful and responsible.) Sharing is encouraged!

Getting in: Enter the building through the State Street Entrance (Between the intersections of State with Court and Chapel) and talk to the Concierge, there are instructions near the call box and a bell button on it if the door is locked. If you really have trouble, pre-movie-start time you can call AJ at 315-345-9348

Parking: There is metered street parking available near by on Orange Street and Court Street.  If you don't mind the longer walk, some of the Yale Lots are free in the evening/weekends. (I.E. Yale lot 51 on Temple Street.) 360's Parking Garage is open to visitors for Credit Card Customers only, the entrance is on State Street just to the Right of the building main entrance. Other local near by businesses may have open parking, however you're on your own there.

 

Don't think I really need to say this, but: This is basically an extension of my home I'm inviting you into, there for I expect everyone will treat it with respect and not risk future events (or my lease).
item.how_to_find_us: Come to the building door, Ring the Bell Button, Concierge will Direct you. If you have more problems, call AJ at 315-345-9348.
item.name: 360 Movie: 28 Days Later
